content:
1, 2014
Early Access Review
								EARLY ACCESS REVIEW:When I first saw the trailer and images on the store page for "Planet Explorers" I thought to myself wow this game has lots of potential, and it looks like lots of fun to play, but to my dismay this is what I got:The game starts out with poor dialogue, its text based, the letters are tiny and the npcs feel dead (Villages feel dull/dead too), the npcs don't really move around or do much, they just sit there, vendors are pretty much useless they only sell stuff that are easy to come by, the only benefit of npcs is the ability to recruit, that being said you gotta get them a full set of gear, because they come into the world like you with completely garbage items.In short term let me make Pros & Cons,--Pros-----Good Concept & IdeaFun DiggingYou can climb any mountain by hugging the wallCreation ModeCons-------Friendly Npc's are completey useless & redundentVillages feel extremely dull and deadEnemy Npcs are too strong (Even at starting level, some enemies can even 1 shot you)Obtaining easy weapons/gear is quite frustratingThe Fatigue system is completely stupid, [when fatigued your rendered useless in every shape way or form]Weapons do to little of damage for enemies your levelMultiplayer Digging/Mining Glitches (Cant see other player tunnel)Swimming controls are awfulMelee Combat aiming is awfulLighting Glitches while in Mines/Digged holesThe time it takes to get places on footGeneral Glitches (Falling through world/underground)Interface is quite awful, the weapons 1-10 bar doesn't work properlyThe Character creation is not that great, & is nowhere near completeMultiplayer Search System is terribleetc........Overall this game is definatly not worth its Early Access price of $20, I bought it for $15 on sale, and its not even worth that. I would say at its current stage the game is worth no more than $5, because they still have alot to prove and bring to the table.

content:
1, 2015
Early Access Review
								EDIT/UPDATE: Something new that really chafes me that I *HAD* to add to my review!  I've tried to wrap my head around it, and even though in some ways I can see the pros, ultimately I have to feel as though it's in direct violation of the Early Access Program rules of Steam.  Now, I'm not trying to go out of my way to make trouble for the developers of this game... I truly think it has tons of potential, tons of possibility to do well, and I just wish they'd get their heads out of the butts and iron out the core features like CONTROL INPUTS for the CORE FUNCTIONALITY OF THE GAME (and before anybody says that controller-support isn't a core function... it's LISTED in their INPUT section under the CONTROL menu, with some Joystick buttons even listed as defaults, while only half of an entire gamepad/joystick works, but also interferes with Xpadder/Pinnacle working properly -- there are quite a few people that have medical issues, myself included if you count aches/pains from old age, that can only comfotably game with a controller... most times I even use a controller to navigate through the OS and such... Unity HAS built-in controller support, so either iron it out, or turn it off so people can use XPadder or Pinnacle!!!  Buyers have been asking/begging for it for OVER A YEAR NOW!).  Anywho, here's what's chafing me... Steam's Early Access is about ANYBODY that pays for early access, gets to experience the game as it goes.  Planet Explorer's decided to make an Alpha-Beta team I guess.  And no, I'm not "butt-hurt that I couldn't be on the team"... as far as I know you just have to opt into it, and anybody in EA can do that as far as I'm aware.  It just blows my mind though, that first you have to pay for EA, expecting to get all patches and updates as they happen, and then a SUB-GROUP is made within that EA for "BETA-TESTING" of an ALPHA!?  WTH!?  Every EA I've played to date, I haven't had to babysit "how I get my patches and when"... when updates are made, you just get them auto-patched via steam.  Now, GRANTED... one of those pros... having a beta-team makes sure it's nothing that will outright break and destroy the game when a patch is pushed, but that's what internal Q/A is supposed to be for; (Or even... I dunno, early-access!?).  So now, of all people that pay for EA, hypothetically 50% that are in beta get the latest "beta updates" as they happen, while those that didn't know or couldn't be bothered to opt into beta, have to WAIT until the devs decide the "alpha patch" is up to "alpha standards!?" before they release it.  Perfect example... I haven't opted into the beta-testing, but I launch my PE game right now, and my currently running and available public version is 0.871... yet, on the steam page for PE, I even quote, the most recent patch is "A0.886 Beta Build Released on Steam" (this isn't flipping WoW with their PTR for crying out loud... this game isn't even in full freaking release yet!!!).  See what I mean!?  When has there ever been a BETA within an ALPHA/Early-Access!?  How long does time have to go on before we have so many silly sub-levels to early-access/beta-testing before it's just too absurd to make anymore sense of!?  "Oh yeah, I'm an alpha-access beta-tester to the early-access beta-alpha which is in place to iron out all updates before they hit the closed-alpha-beta-alpha to ensure that everything is ironed out when the game goes beta-alpha-beta in a couple more months"... WTF!?Well, game seems decent, interesting, fun and procedurely-generated.  Lots of potential in this title.Biggest downside though is, been sitting on this title as it collects dust because of all the so-called "upcoming improvements and fixes".  Controller-support in this game is horribly broken, so much so that you can't even use Xpadder/Pinnacle to map out a custom-config... since the game semi-initiliazes control of the controller/joystick with no options to turn it off on the game-side of things.  Wouldn't be so big an issue, except for people like myself where playing constantly with a mouse and having to sit forward all the time start to kill my back and wrist after awhile.Wouldn't fault the game so much for having broken controller-support... but be nice if devs either got controller-support accurate, or just left it alone so people could again jury-rig their own support via Xpadder/Pinnacle... as it stands it's a giant speed-bump/road-block.Other than that, everything else about the game seems to run somewhat decently and looks really fun... just a shame that those that might require sitting back with a gamepad can't exactly dive right in... been really longing to play this game more.  And for that reason, I can't exactly recommend it... as others might find themselves in the same predicament as myself.  Not everybody has tons of money, and in this day and age several live on a tight budget... with so many broken/problematic games, people want to feel comfortable and confident that they can make a leap of faith in buying what looks and seems to be a half-decent game.  Problem is, gaming controls/functionality are a core-element that by now designers and developers should have figured out... it's not rocket-science, it's not like anybody's reinventing the wheel.  So for the sake that nobody drops the clams on this to find out, as I did, that they're simply unable to play it the way they want to and for a decent amount of time in one sitting, I can't exactly outright recommend this, at least, not without putting a huge WARNING out there.WARNING: If you're able to play for long hours with a keyboard/mouse this game may be okay for you... if you typically need to jury-rig up another input-interface/controller-setup either in a game or jury-rigged outside the game... WAIT and SAVE YOUR MONEY until they confirm there's some sort of fix or update to this. -_-

content:
9, 2014
Early Access Review
								I've only tried the Story Mode so far, and after that, I don't know if I'll be up for trying the other modes.The game has potential but it's still very early to determine what the end result will be. Playing, it feels like the developers are still unclear on what they want to do with some features. From what I've played, quests have been simply going from point A to a very far point B then back, or gather X amount of resources A, B and C, or a combination of the two. They are long, tedious and do little to keep you wanting to play more.The crafting system is decent, but very early on, you'll get very complicated scripts that require you to create many different materials from many different resources in order to create a single Item. It wouldn't be so bad, if resource gathering was fast and entertaining, which it's not. early tools take ages to gather resources, and you're stuck with them until you figure you have to buy more scripts from an NPC.The combat system is barely worth speaking about. If you don't notice the little enemy health bar that appears in the upper left corner of the screen, you won't even know if you're landing any strikes or not, until either you or your enemy are down.You can put items for use in the 1-9 bar, a la Minecraft, and it works well, but the only way to know which Item you have equipped is by looking at the square left of button 1, which shows what you're currently using. I guess that's ok, but it'd be less confusing if it just highlighted the Item you've selected. Another problem is that if you're using a sword and Shield and you change to a pickaxe to do some mining, when you switch  back to the sword, the shield will stay unequipped, forcing you to go and equip it again, which can be annoying considering how you can be attacked at any time.One other problem I had is that throughout the time I spent playing, I felt like I was doing something (or rather everything) wrong. Following the questline brought me to face enemies against whom I had no chance. I constantly wondered if there was something I missed, something that should have prepared me for the challenge, but there seemed to be nothing there.Overall, the game has potential, but I cannot recommend it to anyone, simply because it's too unfinished. I wish I had waited a year or two more to play it in a much more polished state. I know I'll have to wait at least that long to come back to it.

content:
22, 2014
Early Access Review
								unfortunately due to its current state and price I cannot honestly recommend this. The storyline although there, isnt finnished. So only about a third of the map is explorable. Adventure mode offers little challenge. You are just given the plans to make ever item in the game, when you start. And if you dont want to make them there is an always available shop menu.Farming isnt worth doing as you buy a seed, plant it, wait, harvest and then just get 2 of the crop. Then you have to buy another seed. As the crop item can usualy be bought at half the price of the seed. You may as well buy that and not wait.Colony building consists of building 5 to 7 items and placing them, then getting a few people to "live" there. You then supply them with food, water, armour, weapons, assign them a job working the farm. Then thay stand around doing nothing all day.With All that said, this is one of the most promising games I have seen all year. Graphics are almost perfect for the game. Mining is even challenging. Combat is fun although needs tuning a little. Stability is almost perfect with one crash in 24 hours gameplay. Making your own designs of vehicles works fantastic. Using the rocket pack to gain height, then switching to hanglider and gliding around is almost a game in itself.And yes I understand this is an Early access game, but one of the keywords is Game, and currently there isnt enough game to play, and make this worth buying at this price. This is at present an alpha demo and should probabily be free. If you want to support the creators then buy it. Otherwise wait, and keep a close eye on it. If Its finnished, it will be good.

content:
y 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is my first "serious" (use that term rather loosely) review of a game that I've heavily started to get invested in....little back story.I've been following this game for awhile behind the scenes and since it was a good deal and I had a bunch of games I recently added to my wishlist within the last 2 days - I went ahead and bought it for something "different." Personally, most sandbox games are damn near zombie heavy and it just ridiculous how the market has been flooded since Walking Dead (nothing bad about the show)...Anyways...Here comes Planet Explorers - which I might add is a VERY interesting take on open sandbox games with a decent story mode.If you are thinking of getting this game, let me cut to the chase and give a good rundown of what I've seen so far:Note: I would HIGHLY advise doing the story mode first and then tinkering with the Multiplayer. Truthfully, the game is fleshing out rather nicely, but the story mode will take you a while to get through and teaches you alot about the limitations as a whole, so you can actually see what alpha is like right now.Ok, so here it goes:PROS------- Game runs superb on a high end system, and no doubt any moderate pc rig should be able to run this with no issues- Story mode is where you want to start at (although the "tutorial" of the story mode is a little odd to catch on and learn the basics.) If you've played any other sandbox MMO then you'll be able to pick up what you need to do pretty quickly. Also, it will take you HOURS, and yes HOURS to play through the story mode if you happen to go off the path and actually have fun exploring and tinkering with stuff as you gain more options throughout the missions.- Obviously, the game is still in alpha, so just be a bit patient as the game gets built up- Creating in the game is a BIG plus. I have yet to do it, but planning on, hopefully, making some fun items for the community. So far, most of the designs I've been seeing are awesome looking and can't wait to try them out after full release.- PE is a beautiful game where you can sit back and relax, watch the sun set on the beach :)- The interface, regardless of mode, is very easy to use-  Using sentry guns to shoot the hell out of rampaging beasts is a sweet :) Think of Aliens the Directors Cut with the senty gun scene, hehe.- You can make scuba diving items to explorer the water!- Found me a loot chest underground with some random items...who knows what you'll find in the most obscure placesCONS (here are some known issues)------- Multiplayer is a little lax since most are probably steering clear an alpha build- Save often in single player. I only had 1 crash from nearly 10 hours of playing. Logs are written for the crash which should be sent to the devs if you like, but for the most part, this game is very stable.- The music can get a little old and hopefully they'll add in different scores to keep it interesting. Aside from that, crank up your own music list and have at it!- There is no tab targetting in the game, so positioning your toon to chop a tree, loot a body takes a little bit to get used too. There is an option to turn on the HP mechanic, for fighting, so you know you are actually hitting the mob, but it would be good to see the name mobs if they choose to do so in an upcoming build. Although, it DOES make it so you have to "explore" and hunt properly in the game (you really never know what you'll come in contact with) - so maybe this isn't such a con, but it's what we all are most used too.- Finding Tin is a PITA! Just make sure you properly use your mobile scanner and it's updated properly. From there, you'll should be able to see a great 360 degree radar view in how close you are to a vein and how far you need to dig to start mining whatever it is you are searching for.Ok, so this is a somewhat look at my experience thus far. I have to honestly say though, that someone who gets bored with games easily - this one is actually pleasant to play. Since it is still in alpha, one can only imagine what else is going to come next with the updates in 2015. I have some high hopes with this game and hope it makes it to be everything everyone wants in an interesting sandbox/massively endless open world mmo.If you are still undecided on this game, definitely keep a watchful eye on it and with any luck, you'll buy it just for what you can do/and hopefully be able to do within the game :)

content:
ry 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								Edit: 1 year later: The tutorial is a pain, they've updated a bunch  of the graphics, sounds, etc. The theme song has words now (I liked it when it didn't :( ). I get a car really soon so I don't have to walk 500 miles earlly in the game. Yay! It stutters a lot now, but that might just be because of all the stuff I have running in the background. Apparently the story's grown since I last played, so I'll try to see what's new.Has a few bugs, but still an amazing game. It *is* still early access, but generally you won't know.8.5/10I bought this last year (I think), and the interface was a bit iffy. Collecting parts was near impossible and I thought I was just doing it wrong. The new version's UI works just as I'd expect it to (phew, I'm not crazy!). The game is one off the newfandangled voxel based games that are popping up everywhere. You mine, dig, shoot, stab and  cut (animals, plants and the ground) to get materials and use them to make inventory items like guns, healing potions, etc. All the dirt that you mined up? Well, it seems you can use that to build structures a la minecraft. There is also customization of things you build, so you can pretty much build whatever you want. I haven't really played with that yet, the screen scared me since it's too powerful, but I hear it's pretty cool.There is a main mission that you should really play to get the hang of things, and the devs seem to put out frequent updates.

er 28, 2016
												I have been waiting a while to get this game because for a while it was getting many bad reviews. So when it was on sale for 14$ I jumped on the chance to get it. And I haven't been let down. For a matter of fact I haven't been able to play anything else. This game adds many qualities I enjoy from other games into one; Open world,RTS,FPS to name a few I won't lie and say there aren't a few glitchy things but as a early access it is playable. The colony building and the building in general took a bit to get used to but once I did it became crazy fun. Currently playing Story mode and the story, believe it or not, is really engaging. Totally thought it was going to go one way and was taken a different direction. I find myself doing quests more or less just to see what happens next. The crafting system also took a second to get used to. I am used to minecraft and ark type crafting. All in all I say if you enjoy space/futuristic,crafting,building games give this one a chance I don't think you will be disappointed either. Oh and as for the graphics I use a crappy lap top from wal mart on low graphics and it runs fine and the quality isnt bad on fast settings.

content:

												1.0.7.1 ReviewPlayed through all of story mode.  Enjoyable, but ends on a massive cliffhangerCombat:  You can't just slug it out with critters.  Dodge and kite and you'll be fine.  Also watch the skies in the grassland areas, the flying predators will try to snack on you.Colony Building:  Absolutely love this part of the game.  I'm a bit of a base building fanatic and setting up a self sustaining colony is right up my alley.Creation System for designing your own....  well almost everything.  You can design weapons and vehicles from scratch here.  The interface isn't very intuitive and I can't make stuff look good at all, but lots of people upload the specs of some pretty incredible creations.     Wouldn't mind seeing some Dev-made already ingame premades for the vehicles though.       1-2 of each basic type would do (motorbike, landrover, vertical-take-off-landing craft, boats, etc.)Negative Points:  The game still feels like it's in beta.  It's enjoyable, but feels like it lacks the polish needed to be great.  I think the vehicle controls are pretty crappy too.Still recommended, but beware it may feel unpolished.

content:
, 2015
Early Access Review
								First off: This game is very alpha. There's a reason it's early access. It's improving, but don't expect a complete, polished game.On the surface this just looks like yet another ripoff of Minecraft, although in this case with gorgeous graphics. It's not. It takes a whole different angle on building things, giving the player a lot of freedom to shape things exactly how they want—if they're willing to take the time to learn the still-rather-clunky UI. You can build a nice house, but you can also build your own sword, gun, vehicle and various other things. It takes the concept of crafting beyond a preset list of things and almost brings CAD into a game. Extremely unique, and while I can't promise everyone will like it, if anything in my review sounded interesting, it might be worth a try.

content:
, 2014
Early Access Review
								A true Indie gem, I got on the Planet Explorer boat back when the game first showed on Kickstarter. Since then many updates have come to the game. They have delivered so far most of thier kickstarter promises and intend to furfill, in the future upcoming updates, more material that seperates PE from other sandbox games.+Frequent updates+Quick bug fixes+3D sandbox with unlimited potential+Amazing artistic creativity in NPC (wildlife) and a flowing envirement.+In game creation system ( A tool which will allow you to design your own weapons, vehicles, aircraft, and boats)+Inexpensive You cannot go wrong with the price for a sandbox - Sound (basically simple animal sounds and player noises.) In order to better encompass the player in the game a more diverse array of sounds would be great. - AI is almost aweful, with all the NPC's in this game upgrading the AI is peramount to having a fluid game. Too often are NPC followers  stuck in a ditch or animals frozen with utter stupidity.- Camara, this has been updated recently however it seems to still be an issue with me while I am mining/tunneling. Above all, PE is a well-rounded game that deserves more attention. It has a refreshing atmosphere that indeed implores you to explore. I would recommend!

content:
2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Many things to like: lots of freedom, digging, very open world, quests, an engaging plot, building with both prefab and various blocks.  Similarly crafting includes both classic recipe and freeform voxel-oriented forms, with more items being possible to craft freeform over time, as the devs find balanced rules for them.  As with other early access games performance can be a bit sketchy in certain poorly optimized cases, but the game is entirely playable on the reccomended hardware.   A few bugs, but this is not unexpected for early access.Because the game uses a bit more aggressive gpu computation, it will appreciate a flaky gpu less than some lucky games. This is likely to remain the case, and even become true of more other games as time passes anyway, though. :pPersonally, I'd prefer if the design editor felt more integrated with the game - right now it feels much more like a meta process which messes with one's feel of existing in the world a bit. not sure how much this can be improved, given that the editor needs to be usable from *outside* of play as well. I hope they find some sweet compromises, though. :)Overall I quite enjoyed the game in it's current state, and I look forward to playing it more as development progresses, and again whenever it releases.

								If you love Minecraft, you will love this game. To me, it is what Minecraft could have been. If you are an artistic person, you can create so much more than just buildings made of cubes in this game, you can create your own weapons and vehicles as well. You can dig an actual moat around your fortress if you so desire.All in all, I would highly recommend this game to any and all fans of Open World Sandbox/Survival.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
9, 2014
Early Access Review
								I guess now would be a good time to write a review though I have never done one before.Planet Explorers I feel reminds me most of an old mmo called Star Wars Galaxies. This game combines house building, vehicle building, armor crafting, weapon crafting, and technology. As well as the normal monster huting and looting, though it is unlike you will find a weapon on a random creature.This game does have its bugs as is seen when a creature some how manages to float up a tree without moving, but hey... its alpha. The combat is fun though a bit repeatitive on the actions, same swinging animation. But to be honest the game is very fun, and a different trend then the MMO that we are used to. The graphics may fall short but this does not mean that the sceen is any less beautiful. The landscape is vast and its quite daunting to consider how long it will take to explore all of it... and thats just for the main story line.Now I believe something I should touch base on is the crafting system. As I mentioned very indepth but a bit hard to understand first off. Items you need to make you first must get the recipe from mobs or NPC's. After that you then have to find the resources and craft the specific item which is normal enough. But when you look to create a vehicle you must make sure to have the specific items your going to use when crafting it in your editor.The mining, herb picking, and diging is all very fluent and easy to get the hang of. I would highly recommend this game if you are looking for something to keep you interested while waiting for the next big mmo. I personally have not tried the multiplayer yet, but from what I understand it does work... and to be honest whats better then exploring a massive span of land with some friends.I look forward to the future updates this game offers, and I hope many of you enjoy this game as much as I do.

content:
4, 2014
Early Access Review
								I will make this review the most fair I can for people considering to buy this game: This game is very similiar in mechanics of other games such as Starbound and Minecraft but with it's own style. The game is still in early Alpha but with the new update I can see that this developer is providing good updates. What makes the game fun is the ability to create, fight and explore in a procedurally created enviroment. I really like the ability of allowing players to create their own custom weapons, allowing lots of creativity. Some of the ISO's (files that save the design of the custom gun or vehicle) people have created are absurdly cool (recreated vehicles of famous movies). I haven't tried multiplayer but I can see how much fun that will be by allowing games such as free for all or capture the fort, or survival (agaist other players or a creature siege). A lot is still a work in progress however. I can tell the developers are working more on the game engine mechanics. Other things such as more character custimization, more eyecandy,  is for later updates. I will try to list some notable qualities currently in the recent build:   - Has some buffers regarding Health and Stamina - Full open creation of guns and vehicles (cars, helicopters, and now includes making boats and a monorail) - Many recipes to create objects in game (materials to create items such as weapons, food, certain resources, etc) - You have to search your resources (esp ores). Don't expect to dig randomly to find ores. Use your scanner to locate ore deposits.- You can farm your own crops. - Fast travel is allowed (starting colony only at the moment though)- Very large maps (huge in my opinion) and you can also mark and label locations on map. - Animal AI is getting better (pack hunting and herding). It's like you are on Pandora (from Avatar) but you are poaching every living animal and you use their meat as currency (At the moment...it might change, I am speculating) to buy items and resources if you don't wish to create everything yourself. - You can have NPC followers and create your own base and assign them jobs. This is still a work in progress however, IDK how much progress  they made in version A.08 Remember that this is an EARLY ACCESS GAME! Saves can be compromised when updating the game, glitches still exist, the are many areas left to finish. The game itself at its current build is very enjoyable though. So far it hasn't crashed on me yet or have encountered any glitches or game breaking bugs.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
0, 2014
Early Access Review
								Brilliant game. Honestly, the whole colony thing isn't the best part. It's the exploration, challenges, and building. I haven't played multiplayer yet, though. The story isn't done yet, but what is in, is great. The only thing that sucks about it is waiting (Walking Dead Telltale game, anyone?) There are a couple bugs, but not game breaking, some useful in a non-cheaty way (Usually.)The graphics of the character are interesting, not my favorite, but I could care less. Bad stuff:Crashes once every 1-2 hour(s). Not the normal crash though, it freezes, and if you tab out you see a dialog box. The other one is an ingame message with an error. It usually saves often though, so you shouldn't lose much, if anything at all. The ingame error seems harmless, I just save and reload my game. If your game crashes in the launcher, try changing the drivers under options, I was using a nonexistent one for some reason.*EDIT: As of writing this, I have 20 hours played. 20 Hours in a story that doesn't appear to be even close to finished is great, and I can't wait for more.

content:
ber 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								While still in Alpha this game has a lot to offer. Crafting is simple amazing with little limit to what you can make. Design and Build your own aircraft, land rover, house, guns, swords, shields and more keeps being added. By design your own I don't mean you piece it together with prebuilt pieces, like so many other games, I mean completely your own design voxel by voxel. If you want your assault jet to look like a dragon and shoot lasers out of its mouth then go for it. As far as exploring and survival the game thus far offers some interesting enviroments but not much challenge on the survival side. The combat is a bit chunky mimicing something like minecraft but combat improvement is in the works. Story mode is pretty good, it exists for one. Most sandbox games don't even bother but having a story isn't the biggest achievement. The story, thus far, is more engaging then any mmo and half the adventure games out there. It isn't Skyrim quality but its up to snuff. I look forward to additional chapters being added and to see where the story is going to take my character. Overall this is one of few green lite game that are worth buying. There is hours of content avaliable and while updates aren't often they are coming in and I have no doubt the game will be finished as soon as it's ready.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Likely the best voxel sandbox game to come out to date, Planet Explorers gives the player unprecidented freedom to design weapons, vehicles, and buildings; voxel by voxel. Lush environments, a great story line, active ecology, and the ability to harvest from almost anything you can see on screen make this the most compelling sandbox game currently available. As of this writing; there are a few technical issues, none of which are show stoppers (indeed I have only had one crash ever) and most of the bugs are cosmetic in nature. Not bad for a game in early alpha. This title shows great promise as a freeform Adventure RPG and creative sandbox experience. I'm hooked and impatiently awaiting a0.76!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2014
Early Access Review
								Keep in mind that this review is based on the alpha version of the game. Alright to start I can say that at this moment Planet Explorers is not finished at all, however it is still entertaining to play...in single player mode. Single player is by far the most developed, and has an interesting story mode coupled with some voxel building and resource mining which are the current focuses. You can build your own home base, your own vehicles, weapons, and prop with a voxel manipulation program they have. Though if that's not really your cup of tea you do have the option of exploration, and the map is HUGE and has a very alien feeling. I don't want to say too much out of fear of spoilers, but you do get some interesting developments with the story mode on this planet. Multi player is too underdeveloped to really get into. Right now it's generally confined to exploration with your friends or co-op builds. I would recommend this game, but I would suggest waiting till beta is well underway before purchasing.

content:
, 2014
Early Access Review
								Keep in mind that this review is based on the alpha version of the game. Alright to start I can say that at this moment Planet Explorers is not finished at all, however it is still entertaining to play...in single player mode. Single player is by far the most developed, and has an interesting story mode coupled with some voxel building and resource mining which are the current focuses. You can build your own home base, your own vehicles, weapons, and prop with a voxel manipulation program they have. Though if that's not really your cup of tea you do have the option of exploration, and the map is HUGE and has a very alien feeling. I don't want to say too much out of fear of spoilers, but you do get some interesting developments with the story mode on this planet. Multi player is too underdeveloped to really get into. Right now it's generally confined to exploration with your friends or co-op builds. I would recommend this game, but I would suggest waiting till beta is well underway before purchasing.

content:
, 2015
Early Access Review
								First off: This game is very alpha. There's a reason it's early access. It's improving, but don't expect a complete, polished game.On the surface this just looks like yet another ripoff of Minecraft, although in this case with gorgeous graphics. It's not. It takes a whole different angle on building things, giving the player a lot of freedom to shape things exactly how they want—if they're willing to take the time to learn the still-rather-clunky UI. You can build a nice house, but you can also build your own sword, gun, vehicle and various other things. It takes the concept of crafting beyond a preset list of things and almost brings CAD into a game. Extremely unique, and while I can't promise everyone will like it, if anything in my review sounded interesting, it might be worth a try.

content:
ry 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								Edit: 1 year later: The tutorial is a pain, they've updated a bunch  of the graphics, sounds, etc. The theme song has words now (I liked it when it didn't :( ). I get a car really soon so I don't have to walk 500 miles earlly in the game. Yay! It stutters a lot now, but that might just be because of all the stuff I have running in the background. Apparently the story's grown since I last played, so I'll try to see what's new.Has a few bugs, but still an amazing game. It *is* still early access, but generally you won't know.8.5/10I bought this last year (I think), and the interface was a bit iffy. Collecting parts was near impossible and I thought I was just doing it wrong. The new version's UI works just as I'd expect it to (phew, I'm not crazy!). The game is one off the newfandangled voxel based games that are popping up everywhere. You mine, dig, shoot, stab and  cut (animals, plants and the ground) to get materials and use them to make inventory items like guns, healing potions, etc. All the dirt that you mined up? Well, it seems you can use that to build structures a la minecraft. There is also customization of things you build, so you can pretty much build whatever you want. I haven't really played with that yet, the screen scared me since it's too powerful, but I hear it's pretty cool.There is a main mission that you should really play to get the hang of things, and the devs seem to put out frequent updates.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
4, 2014
Early Access Review
								I've been following this game for a couple years now, and it continues to get better and better. It takes a bit of time to warm up to it, but if you give it a chance, you'll find it a deeply satisfying blend of RPG, sandbox, base building, exploration, crafting, and open world survival. The AI NPC's are a fantastic addition, as well as the built-in object editor, where you can download patterns other people have created from within the game. You get to create your own avatar and customize gender, hair, eyes, skin, face, and clothing. That's a HUGE plus in my book.If you're looking for an alternative to Minecraft with better character and creature models, better environmental graphics, more streamlined crafting and building, vehicles, NPC followers, objectives, quests, and more diverse and interesting types of weapons, this is it. Truly an amazing game, even this early in development. I can't wait to see where it goes next.My friends and I have already had quite a bit of fun with this in multiplayer, although at this stage the features could use a bit of work. It would be nice to have a more fleshed out multiplayer story mode. But even as it stands, it's a ton of fun.Devs, if you read this, your idea of enhanced NPC interactions like marriage and procreation? Yes yes! Do it! Also, it appears difficult if not impossible to get NPC followers to heal themselves. Please fix that! Thank you for making such an excellent game.

content:
er 28, 2016
												I have been waiting a while to get this game because for a while it was getting many bad reviews. So when it was on sale for 14$ I jumped on the chance to get it. And I haven't been let down. For a matter of fact I haven't been able to play anything else. This game adds many qualities I enjoy from other games into one; Open world,RTS,FPS to name a few I won't lie and say there aren't a few glitchy things but as a early access it is playable. The colony building and the building in general took a bit to get used to but once I did it became crazy fun. Currently playing Story mode and the story, believe it or not, is really engaging. Totally thought it was going to go one way and was taken a different direction. I find myself doing quests more or less just to see what happens next. The crafting system also took a second to get used to. I am used to minecraft and ark type crafting. All in all I say if you enjoy space/futuristic,crafting,building games give this one a chance I don't think you will be disappointed either. Oh and as for the graphics I use a crappy lap top from wal mart on low graphics and it runs fine and the quality isnt bad on fast settings.

content:
21, 2014
Early Access Review
								I put almost 100 hours on this game in the course of a few of weeks.  If you like 3D modeling and being able to make and immediately be able to play with your creations in game and share them with others then you will get hooked.You can host or play  persistant worlds where players can come and go exploring randomly generated terrain and unique wildlife.   The game is alpha still but VERY playable and few bugs.  I've played for hours at a time without a glitch or crash, though currently the game may run out of memory after some hours until the 64-bit version is ready.There is a little bit of story in single player, but I enjoy hopping on multiplayer servers and meeting others in game.UPDATE: over 650 hours in and it's still my favorite game despite whatever bugs come and go through its early development. Pathea is doing a great job listening to players and making things right for us!This game has excellent support for the Linux community.  There is a native linux client and a headless server that is very easy on resources, even when run on a small VPS.

Early Access Review
								To start off, yes the game is really buggy and DID have slow development. I say DID because they have picked this game back up and sped up the devolopment for than a couple of years ago, but im not saying its fast. they still dwindle a little bit.   Either that or they are working on some huge things. I have really high hopes for this game in general. I believe it has great potentiel Some of the best pros in my opinion of this game is:The voxel creation/customization system.The diversity in the NPCS/Animals.The building and crafting systemVehicles are amazingThe story modeSome of the AI CombatAnimationsExplorationBoss fightingCo-op (kind of, i'll talk about it later)The sandbox. Almost everything is customizable.The open world. This game almost has no limets with that.The NPC trading system.The graphics are really nice to. Still needs a few tweaks but for what it is its good.And it's stability is much greater than what it use to be. The constant crashing made it almost unplayable.Or was it only me that got that? i don't know.Ok i'm to lazy to write out all the cons, because well theres alot. But im going to cover mulitplayer/coopCoop would be really good for this game and its a good game to play with friends, but the coop mode is still in a unstable state. It still works though dont get me wrong, but it can be confusing and i run into alot of problems. This game can be pretty hard going solo and it can go boring after a while to. If i wanted 3 things to be added to Planet Explorers, It would beBetter Coop/multiplayer optimizationMore types of animals/NPCS is always nice, not saying there isen't enough though. Maybe a increase in size for some to? :pAnd maybe better animations, there not the best.:D

content:
y 20
												This is one of those games that SHOULD be in early access. For the price they are demanding from you for this, it's unfinished and buggy.LIST OF ISSUES:The character models are not pretty to look at and are constantly shaking on screen (that could be just me). There isn't a whole lot of customization or armor/clothing choices to make up for it either. As someone who cares a bunch about the look of my avatar, having good armor and weapons to look forward too is great gameplay incentive. But that is missing here.At one point, all of the items in the game got their labels switched around. For the rest of my playthrough, dirt blocks were called "Carrot seeds" and arrows were "Motor Tires" for example.The world is very nice looking and vast, but it's empty and uneventful, besides the plants and trees you can gather. If you're going to make a BIG world, you need to actually HAVE things IN it.The audio work is a mess. Random sounds come from all sides of you and hardly ever sync with the actual direction it's supposed to come from. The ocean could be on my left and the sound of the ocean will come from the right side. Animal sounds and other similar sounds are so much louder and jarring than eveything else and are completely imbalanced. And while we're on the subject, the voice acting is laughable at best.I know this game is focused more on exploration (hence the name) but the "survival" part of the game is lacking. It's more of "meter babysitting" than it is actual survival. It's just a distraction rather then feeling immersive.The one saving grace of this game is the fact that you can shape the land around you freely. You can dig straight into the ground and dig a tunnel, which I actually found fun. Too bad that and nearly every kind of terra-forming in this game is so damn tedious. Chopping a tree can take so SO long, up to 45 seconds sometimes and the digging in incredibly inconsistent. One time you might dig out a bit of land but then the next consecutive clicks only progress you a few centimeters it seems.In short, the first hour or so made for a good laugh but after that there's not much else to look forward to. And my hopes sunk low when I read around and saw that apparently that haven't done much to improve the game since 2014.So I'll keep following this game, but I'm definately refunding it for now.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
1, 2015
Early Access Review
								Alright, so, I like a lot about this game. building is fun, the world is decently interesting, I had few bugs, and only one of them prevented me from ever completing the main story. (npcs I need to complete one quest involving a certain queen of certain crab monsters won't spawn, even after starting an all new game and playing through a second time)But here lie the problems: -that's the only place TO have fun. either you play an easily bugged, massive open world adventure mode where you get to experience everything or you play the survival mode.-survival mode spawns you in a rather small piece of land with only one biome. In the center of the map is a town, revealing that you are a SECOND generation colonist, taking away all sense of "roughing it." All you can do is walk out into the wasteland and get a little iron or copper, but never enough to really build anything good or give a sense of progression. You'll probably end up making a stone hut 10 meters from the town, cowering from enemies you lack the resources to face. this is especially disheartening because it shows that the only way to get to the fun colonies and giant robots part of the game is to play the hours-long adventure mode.-there's a creative mode, but you get the same little patch of land with nothing to do but build with no challenge. pretty standard.-although building is cool, creatures can just knock it down, which means building a home is pretty pointless, because it won't protect you from anything anyway. (unless you want to build a mess of turrets that run out of bullets)-a large portion of the main quest involves walking in straight lines for miles at a time, sometimes just to look at something, then fast travel back. (which costs money)-followers constantly get stuck.-the game has little cutscenes where the camera will pan in to show you something of interest, but these scenes are unnecessarily long.a few days of my life I'll never get back... out of ten.

content:

Early Access Review
								Planet Explorers has come a long way from its Kickstarter days. Comparing it to Minecraft, as is inevitable with a voxel-based sandbox game, Planet Explorers offers a far greater range of user-created content from weapons to structures, and it actually has a story! If you're looking for a survival experience without all the usual horror aspects, and don't mind a Nintendo-hard difficulty spike midway through the current story, Planet Explorers is a wonderful sci-fi-fantasy romp that can only be stopped by Firebears. Seriously... Fire. Bears.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
4, 2014
Early Access Review
								I've been following this game for a couple years now, and it continues to get better and better. It takes a bit of time to warm up to it, but if you give it a chance, you'll find it a deeply satisfying blend of RPG, sandbox, base building, exploration, crafting, and open world survival. The AI NPC's are a fantastic addition, as well as the built-in object editor, where you can download patterns other people have created from within the game. You get to create your own avatar and customize gender, hair, eyes, skin, face, and clothing. That's a HUGE plus in my book.If you're looking for an alternative to Minecraft with better character and creature models, better environmental graphics, more streamlined crafting and building, vehicles, NPC followers, objectives, quests, and more diverse and interesting types of weapons, this is it. Truly an amazing game, even this early in development. I can't wait to see where it goes next.My friends and I have already had quite a bit of fun with this in multiplayer, although at this stage the features could use a bit of work. It would be nice to have a more fleshed out multiplayer story mode. But even as it stands, it's a ton of fun.Devs, if you read this, your idea of enhanced NPC interactions like marriage and procreation? Yes yes! Do it! Also, it appears difficult if not impossible to get NPC followers to heal themselves. Please fix that! Thank you for making such an excellent game.

Early Access Review
								Currently there are game breaking bugs and you need a pretty beastly machine to even run the game at medium settings.As of now I've played Planet Explorers since it was made available to play off and on. This is my review as of version a0.87.Earlier more stable versions allowed me to play with no problems while runing into rare bugs in story mode. I was also able to play with friends in multiplayer mode with little issues though lack of content made it boring at the time.This latest version seems to have implemented game-breaking story mod bugs as well as many performance decreasing issues that have been left unattended to. It seems Pathea takes a long time to release patches and fix issues. But the patches of content they release are amazing compared to other games, however spread very far apart making the patches not so great.I am currently NOT going to recommend the game at this time as Multiplayer can end up boring and Story Mode (Single Player) seems to have a fair share of issues and game-breaking bugs.

content:
, 2016
												1.0.7.1 ReviewPlayed through all of story mode.  Enjoyable, but ends on a massive cliffhangerCombat:  You can't just slug it out with critters.  Dodge and kite and you'll be fine.  Also watch the skies in the grassland areas, the flying predators will try to snack on you.Colony Building:  Absolutely love this part of the game.  I'm a bit of a base building fanatic and setting up a self sustaining colony is right up my alley.Creation System for designing your own....  well almost everything.  You can design weapons and vehicles from scratch here.  The interface isn't very intuitive and I can't make stuff look good at all, but lots of people upload the specs of some pretty incredible creations.     Wouldn't mind seeing some Dev-made already ingame premades for the vehicles though.       1-2 of each basic type would do (motorbike, landrover, vertical-take-off-landing craft, boats, etc.)Negative Points:  The game still feels like it's in beta.  It's enjoyable, but feels like it lacks the polish needed to be great.  I think the vehicle controls are pretty crappy too.Still recommended, but beware it may feel unpolished.

content:
9, 2014
Early Access Review
								To say this game is pretty incredible would be an understatement, but that comes with some major caveats. I am very happy that i paid to support this early access project and i cannot wait for the final product, but i am not sure i am going to allow myself to play further till they expand the content. What I mean by content is not how much the game has to offer but, the way in which the progression takes place. I basically do not want to ruin the experience of this title before it is ready to be enjoyed. While understanding that this game is in alpha right now, in story mode it took less than 3 hours to progress directly from wooden swords to handguns and auto turrets (including processor production for the turrets). This basically meant skipping stone, iron and copper swords/shields/bows varieties, not to mention the countless other recipes that i have completely never had to use. When this game's story mode is quest complete and balanced, i can imagine the necessity of a more balanced progression requiring the use of most recipes encountered. While the game runs pretty reliably, i have had a couple of crashes when switching out of game mode to look up what kind of creature i need to kill to complete a quest. Other bugs seem to be lack of indicating where to click to harvest certain things, text hidden behind mouse cursor, really dumb ai and animals floating in mid air. While the graphics and lighting are stellar the grass textures they are using are animated 2d sprites that rotate normal to the camera, ala trees in mario 64. Pro's: incredible graphicsbeautifully created alien worldfull featured terrain editing/buildinglots and lots and lots and lots of contentCon's:bugs with ai, graphics crashesnot completebalancing issues (too easy)Bottom line this game looks to be a major winner, but i am going to hold out a bit and catch up on some backlog so i can enjoy a more complete experience in a few months.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
er 20, 2016
												As a passionate early adopter of survival, sandbox games, I was quite excited when I first got Planet Explorers. Having play-tested the game all the way through it's early alpha and beta phases, on release I decided to start from scratch and complete the story mode without prejudice.First things first to add some perspective. As a very ambitious sandbox game from a small indie developer, Planet Explorers has exceeded expectation and delivered what was promised. Of course it is rough around the edges and needs polishing here and there but it is playable from start to finish without any major/game breaking problems. Pros:- Good optimization (on a laptop with old-ish GTX860m max settings, a stable 50-60fps; alpha/beta < 30fps)- Solid tutorial- Compelling story line unraveling at your own pace- Adventure mode with some unpredictable/surprising results- World editor for custom tailored multiplayer games- Voxel world implementation to par with alternative bigger titles- Item editor/workshop implementation (easy to use component/parts based design)- Colony building; finished the game with minimal protection but a proper base (from workshop?) should simplify defense- Multiplayer co-op/versus games (re-playability and fun)- Good value for money (40+ hrs to finish story mode, with some workshop experimentation)Cons:- UI looks dated and dialog font is ugly; some conversations sound computerised (or badly acted?)  - When a big battle ensues, fps suffers, e.g. base/colony defense (surprisingly turning grass on/off had no impact!)- Tutorial should be part of the story mode (skippable), as to ease new players into the game (spaceship views of Maria etc)- Story line is linear and predictable. Near end of game becomes a little grindy. No re-playability value here- Limited workshop implementation, ugly item icons, fiddly; no in-game steam workshop access- Item editor is cumbersome when you try to export an item in game (back and forth switching to create required components). A shopping list implementation would made a big difference before completing and exporting a complex item.- Voxel world works great for extracting resources, not so for filling up holes/terrain etc (box voxels, no smoothing)- No accurate damage to complex creations (e.g. helicopter 30% damaged costs almost 100% in repairs but it returns 80%+ mats when recycled!! Doh!)- Atrocious AI pathing!!! The biggest flaw of PE!! Position yourself next to a hill or even better build some quick dirt walls around elite enemies (e.g. robots) and they fumble about left and right while your covered turrets take them down at their liesure ;-(- Some over-powered editor creations, make mince-meat of elite enemies (I've used skeli helicopter 190kph, M16 etc etc)- A number of broken quests (burial, fish in the lake, metamateri for some off the top of my head).- Broken follower commands; stay doesn't work at all, defend often interferes with quests (dismiss to avoid shoot outs)- VIP colonists with temperament; can't get any proper training in, as often they are busy (doing what exactly?)-----TD;LR: Despite the above short-comings, I would recommend Planet Explorers as a well worth "value for money" experience. I thoroughly enjoyed it and can't wait for the sequel (?). I believe it should have stayed in beta to the end of 2016 to fix all the bugs still lurking but nevertheless it is what it is. For creative people and custom PE game hosts, it would provide countless hours of fun. 7/10

								Spawned in at a desert, where the starting shops were on an island in the sea. Ran up the ramp to the shops, glitched through the ramp and died of fall damage, first death.Next, a crazy dinosaur creature starts attacking me and friend, almost one hitting us, we run up the ramp to escape, and i glitch through it and die of fall damage again.This time i am careful to jump over the spot where I keep falling, and stand on the edge of the island, watching the beast. It then one hits me from the ground, and i die again.We get wood bows and start attacking it, but it is doing little damage, but it does appear to be dead, my friend thought it was drowned. I hopped down into the sea to investigate. It wasn't dead, just having a mid-fight nap, it one hit me again.10/10 so fun.Jokes aside, this game is genuinely fun. There is a lot of glitches and loopholes which need adressing and obviously that is ok, as it is alpha.Another thing the developers really need to do is to make it so you can really dumb down the graphics. My PC has a terrible graphic cards, and with the settings on fastest very little seemed to actually change and i still had fairly bad lag.Great game in the making though, should buy.

content:
r 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played game again, because I recall it's potential. TLDR; wait another year or maybe two.Game has lots of problems. Many are solved over course of development, but there are still so many things are left before it's ready. I can't recommend it now. Wait year or two. I seen many dead early access games to recommend to buy this even with discount.Good things:- story mode is totally playable and enjoyable, quests are much easier to progress, storyline is intriguing, too many will die though;- adventure mode feels really good, rising skills, hunting, fighting, making money, exploring;- editor with templates and community made content is cool, it's easy to figure out things by looking at someone's creations;- game doesn't crash at all (could be subjective as I had my PC upgraded);Bad things:- it needs polishing;- it need bugfixes.I am really up to play adventure mode, probably in multiplayer with friends, but I have too strong beta-tester-feelings when playing it. It's simply not ready yet.Below is my old review, pros are still, cons are partially still true (which is very sad).---I must say it's very pretty and addictive game. But in current state I can't recommend it. It has huge potential, idea with building own colony and surviving is cool. But will it become a good game someday? I don't know.Pros:- huge world, different biomes, fauna and flora;- tier-progressing: wood, stone, etc.- many interesting concepts: items builder, monorail, colony-management;- vehicles!Cons:- nothing (!) in game is polished yet, anything you do will smell alpha-version: digging (animation, sound and what is happening is desync), chopping trees (and looking inside empty model of tree);- crappy UI: HD resolution will blow your eyes, "moving" windows (when you want to drag item), crapy inventory design (tabs in 3 categories);- poor perfomance and high demanding engine (it crashes every hour no matter which settings);- very steer learning curve without much assistance (save-load a lot or dig a lot, up to you);- balance is poor: lack of farming motivation (digging 1000 resources is basically enough until end of game and it take only few minutes to get so much), lack of exploring motivation (you will find nothing interesting);- quests: be ready to stumble or use reload when doing any quest, they are buggy as a hell;- vehicles.

content:
ry 23
												The game is too slow moving and the difficulty ramps up to impossible as soon as you finish the tutorial.  It feels like it needed more time easing the game play loop's difficulty curve.  I baught this to play with a friend and didn't have fun after the first two hours.  I'd avoid this.  This is the type of game you won't know doesn't suit you till the refund timelimit passes.The game has good ideas, but the execution needs refinement.  I'll revisit this later if I hear of any updates that improve things.  There is a good game in here, it just needs to be polished a bit more.Update: 3/31As I said I would, I gave this another try for about another 2 hours.  The lack of instruction on what the options actually mean when creating a multiplayer game was very frustrating.  It was also very frustrating when you would play with the tech tree on and you have no option to filter out things you don't have the skill to craft.  Also, the crafting drop down to let you move to a section, like... armor to helmets, doesn't work.  Typing was also buggy, sometimes it didn't accept me hitting enter or sometimes glitched.We managed to have fun once we turned off the tech tree and figured out that we didn't need to find the nodes in the mineral scanner to find some materials needed for crafting, but it would have been nicer if this was better explained to us instead of us just having to find it out.Still, can't recommend this.  If this were in early access I could forgive a lot of the bugs I and my friend ran into, but you released it, so I can't just give you the "Well... it's in EA" excuse.  There can be fun in this, but the bugs will irritate you.If you can put up with it though, it can be fun, but I'm dissapointed by the number of bugs I had run into that ripped me out of the experience.If my opinion changes as I play it I will update the review once again with more details.

content:
1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Ill start with what I liked about the game:The single player is fairly fun, it has quests and the like. Crafting system is very basic and the UI is easy to understand. Graphics are nothing to write home about but are okay and playable in my opinion. The custom content creator is VERY cool which you can make custom 3D vehicles and weapons after getting used to it for about 10 minutes. The content you made can be seen in-game right after you make it (after you purchase it and materials). Its also a voxel game which means the mining and everything is in 3D as opposed to minecraft where its all blocks. Combat can also be fun against certain mobs and large boss monsters. The vehicles and equipment can be fun to use like the jetpack + glider.Why I don't recommend it:First of all the game has been in development for about 3 years now and I still feel like its VERY unfinnished. Most of my complaint is the multiplayer. The lobby is REALLY buggy and attempting to connect to friends can be a pain. Me and my friends played it for about 25 or so hours (steam says only 10 because it disables after you close the launcher) and we pretty much did all that you can do in the game and quickly got bored. Building structures is very lame and unrewarding as there is practically no actual use for them other than aesthetics (they also look terrible). It also feels very awkward to build and you don't get much choice in materials and objects to use. The survival element is mostly just fighting off monsters. Which until you can afford to buy weapons, is almost impossible. You also have NO reason to craft items as you can BUY everything via in-game shop which after you just mine random ores and sell it you can buy anything you want fairly quickly, you get end-game content in under an hour if you wanted.I feel like the game is VERY lackluster in content and will only keep you entertained for 30 hours at most before you get bored of it. They say they will release the game sometime in 2014 and if they do at this state then that means this game is a ripoff. There was also plenty of bugs but because it is early access I won't have that as a reason for my unrecommendation.

content:
ry 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								(version 0.86) So 6 hours of play time and then the game totally stuffs up and I cant load a single saved game.  Hours of fun searching forums for fixes that dont work, and Im forced to start again... FARK!!!!!So far the game looks great, seems like a lot of fun, has potential, but all of that is ruined when the game isnt properly playable.  I know its "early access" but I am SO SICK of that BS excuse devs generally pull out to explain any problems.  You release a game and charge people real money for it, then something basic like loading a saved game fails... leaves a pretty sour taste. (See Update below for possible fix)After 26 hours of play and having (apparently) completed Act 2 of the story, Im about to give up until the next update... I currently cant move anywhere north of the plains zone without the game crashing. Pros:+ Graphics are decent for a voxel game+ Engaging gameplay (think minecraft but more detailed and mature)+ Sounds arent too bad but need refining for distance / ambience effects+ Story campaign is interesting enough so far and a good way to learn the mechanics etc+ Intereting item / building mechancsCons:- Save game issues mentioned (ranted about) above- fairly sparse world - needs more living things- camera needs some work- AI pathfinding needs some improving- Creatures will chase you FOREVER until you kill them or die- Fighting is a little rudimentary- Quest / story bugs...losing track of NPCs etc- MANY random crashes seemingly for no reasonVerdict:Buy it on special and wait until its a bit more ironed out before playing it.  Once the problems are fixed Ill probably change this to a "Yes" reccomendation :)Update:  Turns out the work-around for the save / load issue is to *only* save very far away from where you dig (particularly around the crater), and *not* to dig below sea level... so basically go back to a camp and save there.  Seems to work so far.Note: I am updating this review as I play more...10 Months Later:  Not much has changed.  The game is still half finished and a little broken.  This is why I dont buy Early Access anymore.

content:
r 5, 2016
Early Access Review
-Updated Review-05/10/16EVERYTHING IM REVIEWING HERE IS MY PERSONAL OPINION.So please stay open minded!so as of recently gaining interest in the game once again, i decided to give it another shot!and while the game is fantastic in certian areas it has flaws. some extreme that need addressed and some minior that you can make do with on whatever mode you are playing. first let me just get straight to the point on a issue that needs to be resolved as of now, and il go into the pro's and cons of the game :)The game has moved from a 32bit version to 64bit only version (for now - 32bit will follow but with severly reduced features). the developers are extremely active on the discussions page on steam for the game, so if any questions or concerns with the game that need to be addressed you can post there knowing that a dev will reply in that very day you posted the thread.for anyone interested in the game that has a somewhat mid range PC, Please Be Aware the game is still in beta and optimzation is still a high priority for the devs (judging by comments left on discussions) however.. if you are just slightly above the "Minimal System Requirements" chances are you wont get that great of a gaming experience.the game is primarily GPU intesive and RAM instesive, IMHO the min specs need to be adjusted because a 460 wont even net you a stable 30FPS with the lowest settings (Fastest). im going to give a personal thought on what the min specs should be, just to serve as a guide line for for new purchasers and also to serve as what would be acceptable in terms of FPS!OS: Win 7/ 8 / 8.1/ 10 - 64bitProcessor: Quad Core - i5 2600k or better - 3.2GHz or better Memory: 8+ GB RAM Graphics: GTX 580 or better (dunno about AMD but look up the equivelent)DirectX: Version 10 / 11Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 10+ GB available space (SSD Recommend)Additional Notes: Must have OpenCL compatible CPU or GPU (DX10.1) 32bit can run, but will experience - Extremely bad frame rate / Slow load times for both 32/64bit (devs know about this issue and working on it) and the game has alot of crashes!i say these should be the new min specs because a dual core just simply wont cut it when you get to a certian stage in the game that requires you to make a colony. as soon as you start filling your colony, Your FPS will plummit... HARD! people have said they play fine at 50-60 or even 80-90FPS but when they start filling their colony and hit max population. they say their game hangs around the 18-26FPS / 24-33FPS range!now that the rambling is all done, onto the pro's and consPro's:- Fantastic Huge world to explore (in Single player)- Adventure offers unbound freedom (Randomly generated worlds)- Great World Editor- Amazing creation system (build miscellaneous objects / funriture / guns / cars / planes / heli's / boats / shields etc)- Great in world building - Decent colony managment - Good survival aspectsCons:- Story line is meh (not that appealing)- Voice acting could be better- Some aspects not really that well explained- Clunky camera positioning - very bad mouse options (using anything that requires aiming like bows and guns etc has a crap ton of mouse acceleration, not options displayed in settings)if your PC can handle the game, it serves as a very fun and entertaining game that allows people to build in some ways whatever they like.Total Score:7/10

content:
r 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is amazing. At first, it just seems like a nice solo survival game, but then it morphs into a game where you're creating your own equipment voxel-by-voxel (you can use others' creations if you don't want to design it yourself), building a colony, and managing a group of survivors. In single player, there's a campaign that is well written and interesting. Just with what's in the game now I can highly recommend it. I've played 80 hours up to this point, and I can easily say it's one of my best Early Access experiences. Development speed is on the slow end of the spectrum, but steady. Each release is sizeable, which makes for an interesting replay. Also, the music is fantastic. Seriously.

er 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								Aw yes, Planet Explorers. An excellent game in my most humblest of opinions (I'm probably the most humble guy there is, so I'd trust my judgement if I were you). Invariably fun, fully entertaining, and fully addicting. I've been playing non-stop for the last 127 hours. I haven't eaten, bathed, drank or even got up to use the restroom in all that time. And speaking of not using the restroom; I'm currently selling some quite stained socks if anyone is interested. They uhhh fell in some chocolate pudding... Believe me when I say that 'I definitely didn't defecate into those socks'. Don't ask me why I quoted that statement and I won't tell you how I invented a new type of poopsock, thus avoiding the possibility of breaking my immersion. All jokes aside though - Planet Explorers is a really really great game that is well worth the money. I hope the devs continue their awesome work. I suggest that any who read this should buy it immediately - before the price goes up (not that I know it will, but Early Access games commonly do when fully released). Buy it this very minute or you might be convinced to waste the rest of your holiday cash moneys on some guy's used poopsocks and totally regret it. You just KNOW he's gonna spend it all on new socks. I mean, he can't use the old ones, can he? Well, can he? I'm just asking for a uh friend because 127 hours seems about long enough for dooky squirts to dry. It could create what in scientific communities, is called: 'dooky shards', and they are both painful to be scratched by and will sometimes lead to Sepsis of the feet. Noone wants Septic feet right? Buy Planet Explorers.

content:
er 21, 2016
What I liked: Sanbox to build and craft whatever you want Nice progression of items and techWhat You Need to Know: This game is so unpolished it's like it's still in early access Ok first voice acting is so terrible, why have it if it's bad, just leave it with text only. Trust me it would make the game better Next you have the combat which is so lackluster it makes factorio's combat look amazing. The enemies,some look intersting at first but their animations are lame, attacks are lackluster and overall the combat is floaty and underwhelming. So if your looking for depth in the combat look elswhere.  The first 15 or so hours is fantastic, you get to know the planet, what kills you, new minerals, quest that reward you with new crafting items, and great progression that reminds me of Terraria. After that the quests don't give rewards anymore. This made me not care to progress any further because I seem to have experienced most the game So what is the draw of the game if combat, questing, voice acting and the world get old quick. Well you can design and make your own armor, weapons, and vehicles in their version of of 3D modeling program, (think Besiege but more time comsuming, and you make the whole item from scrath if you want it custom, or just use the templates and modify them) The other draw is building up a base with your own colony with buildings that help you in gathering resources, building complicated crafting items and a place to defend if you want to go all Tower Defense in this game The beginning of the game is so packed with stuff to do, but the late game is filled with so many boring quests it made me quit playing the game, with that said, I will have to not recommend it, even though I enjoyed it for a while I love the factorio style crafting, building your own planes, helicopters and weapons and colony aspect, even though I can't get my self to finish the game right now.My Score:DPrice: 25Main reason for dislike: It's a jack of trades kind of game, lots of mechanics but none are fully polishedGames that it relates to:  Factrio (crafting and colony production) Terraria (Progression early game) Besiege( buidling aspect)

Early Access Review
								Boring game. Seems cool from the preview videos but nobody plays it. So if you're the kind of person who finds enjoyment by yourself with some Lego's and your imagination then you'll probably like this game... but the story mode is kind of empty and lacking... and multiplayer had 5 people on the busiest server... all spread out over the map not even interacting with eachother. Games like this need an active world but instead of the game company running the servers and pushing players to populate one server they allow all kind of people to start their own server and if there is any one on it, its usually like one person. If I could get my money back on this game I would. Maybe in the future more people will play it and it will be worth spending money on... but if you're sick of wasting money on games through Steam that you hardly play... then keep moving. This will probably be one of those.
