content:
9, 2014
Early Access Review
								Note: At the time of this writing, the game is on Alpha version 0.82.I like that you can download objects from other players from right in the game. I haven't been able to try out the multiplayer yet but I'm looking forward to it. The NPCs in the story do a great job of giving you the scripts you need to build almost everything as long as you do the side quests. It's also nice that I can sell my extra wood and marble to them before buying an item to 'trade' my wood/marble for newer tools.I am enjoying the story missions, when I don't run into a quest stopping bug (Up! Up! Up!). The game has its share of bugs like not locking the mouse into the game window during fullscreen. For dual monitor setups, this means your game will go into window mode every time you click outside of it. I change my setup to single monitor when playing. My game has not crashed at all since the 0.82 update.One of the tricks for a few of the bugs you'll encounter is to save your game often. IF you hit a bug, load up your last save and try again. If you get stuck on a quest ad don't have a save; save, quit, load. I got stuck on a quest to rescue some survivors from a stuck ship and almost gave up after reloading a few times and then it suddenly worked without explanation.tl;dr: It's a great game with a few bugs. The game has great potential. If you like sandbox builders and save often, you'll love this game.

content:
16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Amazing game with a huge, fascinating alien world to explore. A nice break from zombies to focus on survival and crafting in more original circumstances. The editor is fantastic once you get the hang of it. So far you can craft swords, blasters, land vehicles, boats, aircraft, and shields in minute detail, using your own creativity to design whatever strikes your fancy. Finding new creatures and alien civilizations and artifacts is awesome. Adventure mode creates a randomly generated world for you to explore, and you can even bring friends! Just keep in mind, randomly generated worlds also feature randomly scattered creatures, so you can find yourself facing off against an enormous UFO while you're still wearing cloth armor and armed with a wooden sword and shield.I am extremely excited to see where the developers take this game in the future!

								People have built ancient ruins, giant temples, castles, Starcraft Ghosts C-10 canister rifle, , keyblades, a lightsabers, a Star Destroyer and a TIE interceptor from Star Wars and Kaneda's iconic motorcycle from Akira.If that plus a history about a misterious alien planet with an unknown inteligent alien species and giant monsters roaming around are not enough to have you interested then nothing will.Also, the game engine was changed and it is beautiful now. content:
27, 2014
Early Access Review
								      This is a game I have been waiting for. If you have ever played Starwars Galaxies this game has almost the same feeling along with many other elements. You are free to explore an open world filled with interesting creatures and terrain. You are also free to create what you want. Along with a block based building system similar to Minecraft the world uses voxel terrain where you can mold the land around you into any shape. You can even create caves with smooth walls rather than the blocky nature we find now in many other sandbox survival games.       Besides the normal building system, you can create your own weapons, items, and vehicles. The crafting system is not a simple customization screen, you actally have to build your items from scratch. Although the creation system is tricky at first once you get the hang of it, it is quite simple. There is also a rich story line which I only scratched the surface of since I tend to lean towards the multiplayer side of the game. The only downside is the game is still incomplete, but that is to be expected since the game is still in development.   I Highly recommend this game if you want the freedom to do what you want then this is the game for you. I give this game a 10/10 due to its great potential and player freedom.

								The early access game has been out and it has a good possible potential to be a good sand box game.Even 6 months on since i last played it some of the OLD bugs are still not fixed.Some of them are npc based, path finding for one through doors, npc money trade. the came thinks the npc does not have enough money for trade when they clearly have in the trade window then after you close the text box that appears the npc ends up with zero funds...When you do trade items the money the npc gains is still far less than the transaction is.NPC creatures still climb over walls and buildings through glitching.A lot of sounds are still missing.When you did a tunnel the light does get darker but too dark as if its the dead of night, even if your close to the entrance of a hole or tunnel.If your fighting with NPC's  you can easily hit them and they turn on you.Huge trees can be walked throughIf your chopping  tree down you have to hold the right mouse, now if you do this and you get attacked then you cant break away from the action and attack the npc thats attacking you.Npc's can see your through objects and earth and attack you or try to.No form of storage to place items in, no chests or crates or boxes. just a npc you give items to... content:
25, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is like Farmville (I mean that in the best possible way), but with great graphics, very pretty world. A bit more dangerous than Farmville, you will probably die, but it's all good, that's what revival shots are for. If you are more familiar with Minecraft, I'm not, it's probably a bit like that. A "Voxel" system.You crash land on a planet and start to learn how to live on that planet. The way the textures are done is great, when you are digging a cave, the textures flow well. The minerals you have to collect are easy to spot when you know what you are looking at, the the handheld device helps you find them. I'm enjoying this game.Pros: Well, pretty much everything for a person like me. You have to find things to work with and then make things from that. With the use of the creation system, the trading of isos will flow well, which will release some creative designs, no doubt. Being that this is still an Alpha, I am very impressed. The potential in this game is interesting. Plants. Guns. Cars. Flying cars. Building. Well designed creatures. Nice graphics. A lot of good things to say.Cons: Alpha? A few minor things functionally I'd like to see, but that's how it is with anything, right? Seems well thought out ideas are still possible through suggestions to the developers. Though I can see how too many ideas, all at once, could be an issue for the developers. That's it.I'm liking this game, it's going to end up costing me too many real world hours. Some costs are worth it. Good game for creating cool things, only you will see, but that's half the fun. I think it's worth supporting. After getting the demo Alpha from the creators site, I was sold. Enjoy.

content:
28, 2014
Early Access Review
								After playing through the first few missions here is my admittedly barebones initial impressions.  First, the graphics: stunningly beautiful.  Very well done and for the most part, they ran well on my machine.  Character creation: Good beginning.  I know that the developers plan to do more regarding that and look forward to seeing improvement in future updates.  For a game that is still in alpha and only recently released on Steam, pretty good--just don't sit on your laurels guys and gals--I'm looking forward to seeing more.  The early tutorial missions are pretty standard run of the mill--the wood chopping seemed to be a bit off though--some trees I could chop for wood, others very similar I couldn't.  I did like that you could avoid combat in the escort missions--I like the ability to not engage in battle as well as to engage.Had a crash when I first tried to launch the game, but that might have been my fault as I closed out the Steam overlay at the same time.  Tried it again and it launched just fine.  The voice acting was ok--I've heard better, but I've also heard much worse--and in AAA titles.  I do have to ask one thing: Is the developer a Space 1999 fan (The old 70s ITV show)? I ask because of the doctor's name--even though the character by that name in Space 1999 was a pilot and not a doctor.All in all, a promising beginning and I hope this game continues to live up to its promise.

This game got my attention with the screenshots, and the ability to create your own weapons and vehicles, with an interface that is like a mix between the game Spore and also Terraria, with blocks. I know someone has already said this, but Planet Explorers is truly what Starforge should have been, and starforge turned out to be very dissapointing, almost a joke, even. So do I recommend this game? Of course! Like I said there are many bugs, but they will be fixed, and surely more content will be added. Thanks for reading!

content:
5, 2014
Early Access Review
								(40 hours into a0.82) I was very very surprised at how much I liked this game and I look forward to it reaching full release at some point. Compared to my 50 hours of time put into Starbound (100 hours into Terraria), I think PE has a lot more going for it. The only clear negatives right now would be an out-of-memory CTD every 40-80 minutes of playtime, and the obvious, sudden "work in progress" placeholders for the story mode missions about 30-40 hours into the game (but suggests maybe another 10-40 hours of story mode at least). Other rough spots include game balancing and some issues w/ colony (micro)management and crafting/block placement.Those kinda pale in comparison to the sense of awe inspired by exploring the (story mode) landscape though. The graphics tend to be a bit cartoony but not much more so than Starbound/Terraria (but in 3D), but the landscape and views can be pretty breathtaking, and (spoiler alert) you can eventually buy/craft a jetpack and a glider, and along w/ a rope gun which gets some use, it reminds me a lot of the awesome feels coming out of Just Cause 2's parachute and grappling hook. The first time I crafted a simple flyer sled put an easy grin on my face too, and I had the odd but welcome reminder of how I felt when I enchanted some uber gear back in Daggerfall and Morrowind to do silly awesome things in a game, or the rush I felt realizing I could fly the jumbo jets in San Andreas.The game has an MMO-inspired mission progression and exploration/open world feel to it, with action gameplay that feels like Minecraft or Terraria/Starbound, married to gathering/crafting partly inspired by Minecraft, with an object-modeling/crafting system that feels both relatively powerful for a game while also being a bit limited in terms of a 3D modeler (even a partly voxel-based modeler). Most of your time will probably be spent exploring the breadth of the oft-times breathtaking landscape in story mode, and some of your time digging out ores (after finding deposits using your trusty ground-penetrating scanner). Story mode also has pretty nicely-written NPC dialogue that fits the graphical style of the game, scifi-ey with just enough cartoon feel to make it feel kinda epic w/o being too serious.Other (good) comparisons I could think of: Spore's exploration gameplay. Mining/gathering in the game isn't too bad either, but I'm not that into that kind of play, and tunneling isn't too satisfying b/c of the slower animation (but you get multiple resource units per swing). There's also no need-based survival-type management, aside from keeping your inventory stocked w/ hp and stamina consumables and ammo/repair mats, but this is similar to Terraria and Starbound which are still nice games without having Wayward or Don't Starve's emphasis on survival.Enough tangents though, PE is a fun game, as long as you can forgive the CTDs and current balancing issues w/ some of the alien creatures you have to fight from time to time (oh yeah, minimal flashbacks to Monster Hunter, at least seeing the size of some of those beasts, but don't get me wrong, combat is fairly straightforward in PE). I'm still starting out in adventure mode, so I don't know if PE's story mode strengths carry over, but my initial impression is that landscape/map generation could probably use some work.BTW, the map is pretty big, as in it take a while to hoof it from place to place even in one biome. There's Fast Travel to landmarks, but you also eventually get the ability to build cars, boats, or flying vehicles if you like (even making them into gun platforms), or as I said up top, you could jetpack into the sky then switch to glider to take to the skies (plus rope gun if you want to scale mountains w/o burning (camp-rechargeable but also craftable) battery).

content:
11, 2014
Early Access Review
								I recently purchased this game when it was on sale for $15.  I feel it was worth that.  I have completed the story line for as far as it goes once, and logged most of the rest of my hours on the Adventure mode.  I tried the multi player for just a couple of hours.Pros:It's a beautiful game.  I really enjoy the look of the world.I like the basic crafting.  It's easy to find what you want in your recipes, and the resources are automatically selected if you have them, or indicated if you don't.I like the potential of the ISO creation tool. But as I will mention below it has drawbacks.I love the rope gun.I love the jet pack.I love the glider.I love being able to create a settlement.I like being able to recruit villagers to participate in my base.I like the farming.I like the resource gathering.Cons:The ISO creation tool was to difficult for me to figure out.  (the good news is there are sites available to download other peoples creations, and many of those are just beautiful)Weapons and monsters aren't well balanced.  Early weapons are nearly useless, ISO created weapons are too devastating.  Vehicles run out power/become damaged too quickly.  It's usually easier to just use your jet pack and glider than to bother pulling out a vehicle to get where you are going.Vehicle weapons are too weak.  It's quicker to just get out and kill the monster with your rifle, than to try blasting it with your vehicle cannons.There is a lack of sentient creature aggression.  Aliens attack if you run into them, but the never attack your base.  Animals will attack.  But they aren't a challenge.  The toughest thing is looting all the corpses that litter the field before they disappear.Settlement mechanics are still pretty sparce.  I am looking forward to those being fleshed out  in the future.There are a lack of building machines for tunneling, leveling, and raising land.  It's all done with a pick and a shovel.  I am looking forward to heavy equipment to speed up the beautification of my base.You can't replace natural earth that is removed.  So if you are trying to make a level spot for your garden and you accidentally hit the wrong spot, there is no way to fix it short of loading a previous save.
